conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relative positions of objects and light source.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground in front of the objects.
Light source is positioned in front of the objects.
Shadows will shift towards the opposite direction when light source moves to the back left or right.
If light source moves to the back left, shadows will move towards the front right.
If light source moves to the back right, shadows will move towards the front left.
Size of shadows will increase as light source moves further away.
Shadow A (Glove) moves towards the front right if light source moves to the back left, and towards the front left if light source moves to the back right.
Shadow A (Glove) size increases as light source moves further back.
Shadow B (Ring) moves towards the front right if light source moves to the back left, and towards the front left if light source moves to the back right.
Shadow B (Ring) size increases as light source moves further back.
Shadow C (Corkboard) moves towards the front right if light source moves to the back left, and towards the front left if light source moves to the back right.
Shadow C (Corkboard) size increases as light source moves further back.
Shadow D (Envelope) moves towards the front right if light source moves to the back left, and towards the front left if light source moves to the back right.
Shadow D (Envelope) size increases as light source moves further back.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift towards the opposite direction and become larger.
